actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking.
Committee on Banking requested executive comment from HUD.
Committee on Banking received executive comment from HUD.

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to facilitate the participation of small cities on or near the border between the United States of America and the Republic of Mexico in the urban development action grant program, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 to direct the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to make technical assistance available to assist cities located on the border between the United States and Mexico which have populations of less than 50,000 to develop, apply for assistance for, and implement programs that are eligible for urban development action grants. Requires the Secretary to give full consideration to grant applications from such cities, especially with regard to applications involving industrial or commercial facilities other than hotels or transient housing.

titles.title: A bill to facilitate the participation of small cities on or near the border between the United States of America and the Republic of Mexico in the urban development action grant program, and for other purposes.
